commits.subject: Add discovery analysis and update Phase 3 scope
commits.body:
- Add DISCOVERY_FRAMEWORK.md for structured requirements gathering
- Add DISCOVERY_ANALYSIS.md documenting key findings:
  - Users pay in ZAR via EFT (not crypto)
  - Manual settlement (admin mints tokens after payment)
  - KYC deferred to later phase
  - Unum API only provides fund list (not NAV)
- Update IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md Phase 3 with simplified flow
- Update TODO.md with Unum blockers
- Update USER_ACTIONS.md with pending Unum requests

commits.subject: Fix MPC key generation order and post-login navigation
commits.body:
MPC Key Generation:
- Fixed "Device setup is incomplete" error by calling initEmbeddedWalletCore
  BEFORE assignWallet in Auth.store.ts
- SDK requires deviceId via initializeCore before wallet operations
- Fixed premature getMyDevices() call for new users in FireblocksSDK.store

Post-Login Navigation:
- AuthCallback now checks for deviceId before deciding route
- New users (no deviceId) go directly to /login showing GetStarted
- Existing users (has deviceId) go to dashboard
- Fixed LoginPage using wrong redirect function (was for loaders, not components)
- Disabled unused NEEDS_RECOVERY status check to fix TypeScript error

commits.subject: Restore Google Drive backup with Firebase Auth
commits.body:
Add OAuth integration for Google Drive backup:
- Request drive.appdata scope during Google sign-in
- Store and cache OAuth access token with 55-minute expiry
- Re-authenticate automatically when token expires
- Add getGoogleDriveAccessToken() to IAuthManager interface

Fix backup cancel flow bug:
- Errors now propagate properly instead of being silently caught
- Canceling Google popup no longer triggers password creation dialog
- Only continue to create new backup if "Not found backup location" error

commits.subject: Add session lock, new browser recovery flow, fix API spam
commits.body:
Security & Session Management:
- Add 5-minute inactivity timeout with session lock
- Password creation mandatory during first-time setup
- Activity timestamp persisted to localStorage (survives refresh)
- Session unlock verifies against PBKDF2 hash

New Browser Recovery:
- WalletSetupDialog offers recover/create choice
- Fixes bug where new browser created new wallet silently

API Spam Fix:
- Removed premature listenToTransactions() from initEmbeddedWalletCore()
- Polling now starts in Auth.store.ts after isMPCReady is true

Dead Code Cleanup:
- Removed unused NFT/Web3 API files

Docs:
- Updated USER_FLOWS.md with Security & Session section
- Aligned IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md with new flow structure

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.title: Add session lock, new browser recovery flow, fix API spam

Testnet workspace - not the separate sandbox.fireblocks.io environment.

commits.subject: Switch from Supabase to Firebase Auth (RS256 requirement)
commits.body:
Fireblocks NCW OAuth requires RS256 JWT signing, but Supabase uses ES256
which is fundamentally incompatible. Updated all documentation to reflect
Firebase Auth as the chosen provider.

- Update CLAUDE.md with Firebase config and OAuth settings
- Add AI_MISTAKES.md to document the Supabase/Fireblocks incompatibility
- Update USER_ACTIONS.md with Firebase migration checklist
- Update SESSION_NOTES.md with current status
- Add debugging logs and fix initialization order in App.tsx and stores

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.title: Switch from Supabase to Firebase Auth (RS256 requirement)

commits.body:
The app now uses only the Fireblocks Embedded Wallet SDK with Supabase
Edge Functions. Removed all proxy backend related code and configuration.

- Delete src/api/ directory (proxy backend implementation)
- Delete backend-proxy.env configuration file

commits.subject: Fix auth flow issues and add debug logging
commits.body:
- Fix BigInt error: generate device ID before SDK init in Auth.store.ts
- Add debug logging to API calls and Fireblocks client
- Update Edge Function to use --no-verify-jwt (Supabase gateway issue)
- Document Fireblocks API credential troubleshooting steps

Current blocker: Fireblocks API returning "Unauthorized: Error getting
User certificate" (code -7) - requires verifying API Key ID matches
the value set in Supabase secrets.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: Update documentation to reflect current implementation status
commits.body:
**What Changed:**
- Updated app.json to use coin-zapp branding (removed template references)
- Created .env.example with correct environment variable names
- Rewrote README.md to clearly separate implemented vs planned features
- Updated docs/HISTORY.md with all 5 commits from git history
- Added current status sections to docs/TODO.md and docs/Koinz_Setup_Guide.md
- Added implementation status section to claude.md

**Why:**
- Documentation was describing the target state as if fully implemented
- Template artifacts (expo-supabase-starter) needed to be replaced
- Environment variable naming was inconsistent between code and docs
- Missing .env.example file that README referenced
- Needed clear distinction between what exists vs what's planned

**Impact:**
- Developers can now see actual project status at a glance
- Setup instructions are accurate and won't cause confusion
- Documentation links are corrected
- Git history is properly documented in HISTORY.md

**Files Changed:**
- app.json: Updated branding and bundle identifiers
- .env.example: Created with correct variable names
- README.md: Added status section, fixed structure, corrected links
- docs/HISTORY.md: Documented all 5 commits with context
- docs/TODO.md: Added current status overview
- docs/Koinz_Setup_Guide.md: Added setup progress tracker
- claude.md: Added implementation status warnings
commits.title: Update documentation to reflect current implementation status
